metadata.title: CVE-2021-3654 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in openstack-nova's console proxy, noVNC. Bycrafting a malicious URL, noVNC could be made to redirect to any desiredURL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-ironic - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-libvirt - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-vmware - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-serialproxy - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
python3-nova - 3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3:25.0.0-0ubuntu1').
